Company: University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) School of Medicine
Description of incident: A laptop containing files with information on 4,400 patients was stolen from a  UCSF School of Medicine employee. Information “potentially exposed” included  name, medical record number, age and clinical information, but the stolen laptop  did not contain any Social Security numbers or other financial data. The same  laptop also contained data for approximately 2,900 patients at Beth Israel  Deaconess Medical Center in Boston
